stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream refining the new “block boss” fight: coding its flee-from-Mario behavior, panic/damage animations, soap-based attack logic, and brainstorming a complete arena redesign while juggling N64 memory limits.

development_findings.summary: The block boss now flees along a circular path, always choosing the direction furthest from Mario; its speed and turn rate scale with remaining health.
development_findings.quote: He should be running away in the circle here to the direction that is further away from Mario… we’re gonna make it so the block goes faster the more damage he has.

development_findings.summary: When Mario rides a soap bar the boss takes damage; soap gradually shrinks, needs stronger particle/visual cues, and will eventually spawn faster.
development_findings.quote: You should see the soap run out because it gets thinner… we definitely have to make the soap get used up much quicker than this.

development_findings.summary: A bright prim-color flash (shift to orange) is being added as a per-hit damage indicator, controlled in the combiner rather than a new GeoASM.
development_findings.quote: Still haven’t used the cool prim color flashing effect—oh, right, let’s add that right now.

development_findings.summary: Grill platforms around the oil pool will rise and fall; remaining on oil or missing the grills will inflict continuous damage, tightening the risk-reward loop.
Soap bars will be thrown in by a janitor Koopa NPC located in a side cage; path will bounce across the whole arena so players always see it.
development_findings.quote: He’s the only guy that you help in this level—the janitor with his bucket who just throws soap bars at you.

development_findings.summary: Arena concept pivoted from a cylindrical oil barrel to a tilted, half-sunken warehouse/cave hybrid with metal walls and cages for ‘strike workers’.
development_findings.quote: Maybe this should just be differently gated off… a warehouse built into a cave. That’s a very cool idea, I like it.

development_findings.summary: Off-stream performance optimisations and mat-stack fixes have ‘sick’ impact on the fight’s framerate.
ROM size is already 45.9 MB (≈70 % music) against a 64 MB hard limit; options include converting some streamed tracks to sequenced/mono and skipping a streamed song for Course 12.
development_findings.quote: Two-thirds of the ROM is just music… we can probably free about 1 MB right now with no drop in quality, maybe even 2.

development_findings.summary: Memory discipline: Kaze re-uses the global ‘health’ field as a custom per-object counter to avoid expanding the object struct by four bytes across every instance.
development_findings.quote: Because that would expand the object struct and we would lose four bytes for every object in the entire world.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 bugs (animation resetting, switch bones) continue to slow level work; Kaze flags these for Lilaa to fix.

context_findings.summary: YouTube’s ad-block crackdown nearly doubled Kaze’s monthly revenue, giving unexpected financial breathing room.
context_findings.quote: For some reason on YouTube I made so much more money… honestly, if it means I make more money I support this ad-block thing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze grew up in Germany, now lives in Canada, and has just bought a house—moving on the 23rd.
context_findings.quote: Yes, well I live in Canada right now but I used to live in Germany… we bought a house, we’re moving on 23rd.

context_findings.summary: He dismisses concerns over profanity, calling them an ‘American concept’, and rails against games that feel like chores or gate progress behind keys.
context_findings.quote: Video games are not supposed to be chores! That’s my rant for the day.

context_findings.summary: Rants about Immanuel Kant reflect a playful but firm philosophical stance: separating ‘wanting’ something from believing it ‘ought’ to be that way.
context_findings.quote: There’s a difference between me saying I want something this way and me saying I think it’d be good if something was this way—Immanuel Kant is a fucking asshole.

context_findings.summary: Prefers doing complex coding off-stream and keeps streams for repetitive or visual polish tasks.
context_findings.quote: When I work on actually complex things… I probably work faster off stream.

biobak.summary: Provided shader/combiner guidance, questioning color math and suggesting alternate primitive settings.
biobak.quote: My second question is, why can’t I do tex0,0,0,shadeColor to add instead of multiply? But it turns out you can.

biobak.summary: Gave artistic feedback on the boss’s facial expressions, eyebrow ideas, and overall arena textures/light.
Flagged model/texture alignment issues and helped adjust text positioning for consistency across levels.

badub.summary: Composed a new track for the ‘boombox Koopas’, which Kaze praises as ‘really good’.
badub.quote: We have a new song for the boombox Koopas that Badub made, it’s really good.

key_stories.title: Building the Soap Block Boss
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s goal is a skill-inclusive, visually comedic boss that leverages a soap-surf mechanic. Early issues included one-directional fleeing and no feedback when damaged.
key_stories.challenge: The boss felt static and easy after initial implementation.
key_stories.process: Implemented angle-based flee logic, added panic animations, prim-color flashes, and scaled speed; brainstormed soap spawn via a janitor NPC.
key_stories.outcome: Core loop now feels dynamic; remaining tasks include grill hazards, oil damage, and final particles.
key_stories.key_quote: I think this is like the base animation and then we add more animation on top—now he’s panicky, I like it.

key_stories.title: The 64 MB Wall
key_stories.summary: With the ROM already at 45.9 MB and 11 of 15 courses done, Kaze confronts the N64’s hard cartridge limit.
key_stories.challenge: 70 % of current size is streamed music, leaving little space for remaining levels.
key_stories.process: Audited sound bank; discussed converting certain tracks to sequenced/mono and foregoing a streamed song for Course 12.
key_stories.outcome: Believes 1-2 MB can be saved immediately; long-term plan still open.
key_stories.key_quote: The ROM is 45.9 MB—that’s almost three-quarters of the 64. We have an issue of just not having any more space for music soon.

key_stories.title: Surprise YouTube Pay-Raise
key_stories.summary: YouTube’s anti-ad-block measures doubled Kaze’s channel income in one month.
key_stories.challenge: Previous ad revenue was modest; he rarely paid attention.
key_stories.process: Noted higher views and watch time but a disproportionate spike in revenue; speculated crackdown as cause.
key_stories.outcome: Extra ~$400/month eases costs (e.g., could cover YouTube Premium) and reinforces support for the policy.
key_stories.key_quote: If it means I make more money, I support this ad block thing—I don’t give a fuck.
